content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Overview\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The purpose of this policy is to provide information about EPAM's uniform practices for sponsoring foreign national employees for immigrant (i.e., lawful permanent resident) status to reside permanently in the United States. Non-immigrant visas are for foreign nationals coming to the United States to work, visit, attend school, etc., but do not provide the ability to live or work in the United States on a permanent basis. Immigrant visas however do provide the ability to live and work in the United States on a permanent basis. Synonymous terms for immigrant status are: permanent resident, immigrant, green card holder, and resident alien.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" These uniform practices will facilitate the processing of EPAM sponsored immigrant visa applications, and will enable EPAM to meet business needs while also ensuring compliance with federal law.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Scope\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The requirements outlined in this document apply when any EPAM business unit or function is sponsoring a foreign national for an immigrant visa (i.e., permanent residency).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Responsibilities\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM's Legal, People Management, and Global Mobility departments are responsible for developing, revising and administering this guideline.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Sponsorship Decision/ Commencement of Green Card Process\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The decision whether or not to sponsor a foreign national for any type of employment-based visa belongs to the EPAM business unit or function where the individual works or is being considered for employment. The decision also requires approval from People Management. This decision will be based on consideration of the specific circumstances involved. Typically these circumstances include the business need for the foreign national's services, the quality of the foreign national's case for obtaining the visa (e.g., whether the case is deemed likely to succeed), and the work performance of the employee. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Under normal circumstances, extending an offer of full-time regular employment to a foreign national candidate indicates that EPAM will sponsor the employee, plus his or her spouse and dependent children (under the age of 21), for a non-immigrant visa.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"For immigrant visas (i.e., permanent residency), EPAM requires that an employee be working for the company in the United States for a minimum of \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"twelve (12) continuous months\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" before the employee and/or his or her manager may ask that EPAM initiate an application on his/her behalf, unless otherwise outlined in an offer of employment. Requests are approved based on business conditions and the individual's overall job performance. Unlike in in the case of non-immigrant visas, when it comes to immigrant visas, EPAM will sponsor/cover costs these solely for the employee, and will not sponsor/cover any costs/fees related to the employee's spouse or dependent(s).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The decision to sponsor a foreign national for an employment-based visa does not create obligations for EPAM to continue the employment of the individual. However, where continued employment is viewed as unlikely, a request for sponsorship should not be made.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Additionally, while the employment relationship remains at-will, meaning both EPAM and the employee may terminate the relationship at any time, for any lawful reason, with or without notice, it is EPAM's expectation that any employee seeking sponsorship by EPAM intends to remain employed by EPAM for a reasonably long period following the approval of permanent resident status (at least for 12 months). Employees that do not have such an intention should not apply for or be granted sponsorship. EPAM may withdraw the I-140 in the event an employee does not remain employed for a reasonable period after approval of permanent resident status. \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A resignation within 6 months after a Green Card is received will be considered a breach of this good-faith agreement, and EPAM may rescind its sponsorship.\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Legal Representation\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The application for an employment-based immigrant visa sponsored by EPAM belongs to the company, not the foreign national on whose behalf the application is filed, to the extent permitted by law. All applications, without exception, for any visa sponsored by EPAM must be approved and processed through EPAM's Global Mobility team with the legal assistance of the EPAM-appointed immigration legal counsel.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Sponsorship Funding \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"When applying for an immigrant visa (i.e., permanent residency) on behalf of a foreign national employee, \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM will pay all legal fees and costs associated preparation and filing of the I-485 Adjustment of Status Application, including any EPAM approved applications for interim Employment Authorization and Travel Authorization for the employee, and any other costs not identified above, to the extent permitted by applicable la\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM will not cover any costs or fees associated with an employee's dependents. EPAM will not pay for Premium Processing of I-140 petitions absent a specific business need. Any request for Premium Processing by the employee and/or his/her manager must be approved by Global Mobility. An employee may choose to pay the Premium Processing filing fees, plus any associated legal fees, by working directly with EPAM's immigration counsel.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM will not cover the costs for subsequent green card applications (for example, a second PERM application to convert from EB3 to EB2), absent a specific business need (for example, the employee changed positions and/or locations at the company's request). \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"In the event an employee becomes eligible for permanent residency via an alternative basis (example: through marriage), the employee must provide notice to EPAM. If the employee wishes to pursue the alternative basis, then EPAM will cease its sponsorship of the employment based immigration visa. If EPAM had already commenced the sponsorship process and paid any fees/costs, it will not cover any further fees/costs associated with employee's pursuit of the alternative basis. If EPAM did not commence the sponsorship of the employment based visa and did not already pay any associated fees/costs, then EPAM will cover any required fees/costs for the alternative basis up to the anticipated cost of the employment based visa.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Strategic Decisions\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Strategic decisions with respect to the preparation and filing of an application for permanent residence, including the appropriate preference category in which to file the application, submission of a Premium Processing request, concurrent filing of an I-140 and AOS, etc., shall be determined by EPAM and EPAM's immigration counsel. While an employee may have input during the decision-making process, all final legal and strategic determinations will be made by EPAM. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Repayment Requirements:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If an employee voluntarily resigns from employment with EPAM for any reason, or if EPAM terminates the employment relationship for cause, as determined by EPAM in its sole discretion, within 2 years of the date that EPAM incurs any costs in the permanent resident process for an employee, then the employee must repay all legally permissible fees and costs incurred during the previous 2 year period. In the event of resignation, repayment will be made in full by no later than the employee's final day of employment. In the event of termination for cause, repayment will be made in full within 10 days of the employee's final day of employment. \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A termination based solely on lack of available work does not qualify as “for cause” under this policy, and therefore will not trigger a repayment obligation.\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Any implied.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Disclaimer\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A
